text:
```I've removed locally all the opinionated CSS in announcements_feed.dialog.css, like colors, and left only paddings/margins and hidden undesired visual elements like the default title pencil icon.```
this the comment from ckrina, apparently this is the what the patch has now fixed... ie removing the all extra css and retaining only the padding and the margin stuffs.....
also the second part:
```Claro's visual improvements can be added later as a follow-up, or at least they shouldn't appear when Seven is enabled right now.` ```
is also done with the new patch. <https://www.drupal.org/project/announce/issues/3245363|here>

text: I’d say my main concern is the button styles. They’re using a white outlined version in top of a blue background. We don’t have anything using the accent color as a background (and I’m not sure we want it) with outlined buttons (which we’re not using yet) in a white variant (that we haven’t defined anywhere. <https://monosnap.com/direct/ZBwZa4tAIKlyWx38YMhIHH6mt7MuGe>

elements.text: I’d say my main concern is the button styles. They’re using a white outlined version in top of a blue background. text: I’d expect this would need a round of design (someone making a proposal and approving it), which I’m afraid would block committing this until it’s done. That’s why maybe I’m wondering if it makes sense to commit it without specific styles and improve it in a followup.

text:
My take is it's reasonable to move the Claro part into a followup provided the current buttons don't introduce any accessibility issues, so check for stuff like:
• The buttons have visually distinct hover and focus states
• All of those states meet AA contrast requirements
• They're keyboard navigable
My rationale for this: while it's not acceptable to introduce accessibility bugs, I'm fine adding a little bit of tech debt to an _experimenta_l theme as long as it's added to the roadmap to Claro being Stable There are plenty of other parts of Claro that are acutely unfinished and look less than perfect. I can appreciate those who might be reluctant to knowingly add tech debt, but I feel adding a little bit of manageable debt to an unfinished + experimental theme is a fine tradeoff for maintaining momentum on a great new feature with healthy community enthusiasm behind it.
